Name: Amarita
Ingredients: 3 drop Saline solution 4:1 (20g sea salt to 80g water)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of length of lime peel.
Review: The name of this bitter bittersweet and sour Margarita riff references amaro (meaning bitter) and the use of an Italian bitter liqueur. Many will want to add 5ml (1 bar spoon) of agave syrup to rebalance this cocktail.
History: Adapted from a recipe created in 2007 by Neyah White in San Francisco, USA.
Nutrition: One serving of Amarita contains 152 calories
